content: Stock cards are standard UNHCR documents that consolidate the information of multiple bin/stack cards relating to the same item and PO in case it is stored in different bins/stacks of the warehouse. They should be continuously updated by the warehouse and maintained in the warehouse area. In smaller warehouses, they provide the same information as the bin/stack card. In larger warehouses, they consolidate the information of multiple bin/stack cards and show the total inventory holding of an item/PO which is stored in different bins/stacks. Warehouses equipped with professional inventory management systems can be exempted from maintaining bin cards.

Stock cards are standard UNHCR documents that consolidate the information of multiple bin/stack cards relating to the same item and PO in case it is stored in different bins/stacks of the warehouse. They should be continuously updated by the warehouse and maintained in the warehouse area. In smaller warehouses, they provide the same information as the bin/stack card. In larger warehouses, they consolidate the information of multiple bin/stack cards and show the total inventory holding of an item/PO which is stored in different bins/stacks. Warehouses equipped with professional inventory management systems can be exempted from maintaining bin cards.

Stock cards are standard UNHCR documents that consolidate the information of multiple bin/stack cards relating to the same item and PO in case it is stored in different bins/stacks of the warehouse. They should be continuously updated by the warehouse and maintained in the warehouse area. In smaller warehouses, they provide the same information as the bin/stack card. In larger warehouses, they consolidate the information of multiple bin/stack cards and show the total inventory holding of an item/PO which is stored in different bins/stacks. Warehouses equipped with professional inventory management systems can be exempted from maintaining bin cards.

Stock cards are standard UNHCR documents that consolidate the information of multiple bin/stack cards relating to the same item and PO in case it is stored in different bins/stacks of the warehouse. They should be continuously updated by the warehouse and maintained in the warehouse area. In smaller warehouses, they provide the same information as the bin/stack card. In larger warehouses, they consolidate the information of multiple bin/stack cards and show the total inventory holding of an item/PO which is stored in different bins/stacks. Warehouses equipped with professional inventory management systems can be exempted from maintaining bin cards.

The UNHCR office must ensure that the MSRP Inventory module is updated daily with all inventory transactions, i.e. PO inter-unit MSR receipts and MSR Pick & Ship (dispatch). Inventory transaction may only be recorded in MSRP upon receipt of documentation from the warehouse providing proof of the physical movement, such as Waybills and GRNs. The UNHCR office shall establish a filing system for hardcopy documents related to warehouse transactions and inventory holdings, and retain them for five years. The following documents need to be filed: contracts/POs; Goods Receiving Notes (GRNs); Waybills and Delivery Notes; Inspection & Weekly reports; Bin/Stack Cards & Stock Cards; Inventory counting sheets.

Human: What is a Goods Receiving Note (GRN)?
AI:
A Goods Receiving Note (GRN) is a document used by businesses to confirm the receipt of goods from suppliers. It details the products received, the quantity, and the condition of the goods upon arrival.

In larger warehouses, they consolidate the information of multiple bin/stack cards and show the total inventory holding of an item/PO which is stored in different bins/stacks. Warehouses equipped with professional inventory management systems can be exempted from maintaining bin cards.
